title: Jennifer Aniston wears long white dress at Aveeno Microbiome in LA
text:
She's been making the rounds to promote her new Apple TV+ series The Morning Show, in which plays a veteran morning show anchor named Alex Levy.

And on Tuesday, Jennifer Aniston joined a room full of women at an Aveeno Microbiome panel discussion in Los Angeles.

The Friends star, 50, looked radiant as she fielded audience questions in a sleek white dress.

Radiant: Jennifer Aniston, 50, joined a room full of women at an Aveeno Microbiome panel discussion in Los Angeles on Tuesday

Aniston paired the look with beige heels, accessorizing with a silver wristwatch and a few gold rings.

Her classic brunette locks were worn down in a sleek straight style with a middle part that framed her face.

The only color on the actress was found on her feet with a bright red nail polish on her freshly painted toes.

The We're the Millers actress kept her makeup to a minimal with rosy cheeks and a pink pout.

Classic cut: Jennifer's classic brunette locks were worn down in a sleek straight style with a middle part that framed her face

Glow! The Friends star looked radiant as she fielded audience questions in a sleek white dress

In an interview with Entertainment Weekly last month, the actress said she can understand not wanting to be famous.

Her role in The Morning Show 'never could've come to me any sooner than now,' she said, as it presented a significant professional challenge.

'It's one of the hardest jobs I've had,' she explained, continuing, 'I knew I was up to the task, but then there was the excavation of all the emotions in order to create this world for this woman.'

Fresh: The We're the Millers actress kept her makeup to a minimal with rosy cheeks and a pink pout

Sleek: Aniston paired the look with beige heels, accessorizing with a silver wristwatch and a few gold rings

Simplicity: The only color on the actress was found on her feet with a bright red nail polish on her freshly painted toes

'All of her lifelines are falling away. I would walk out of some of those scenes feeling like a manhole cover just came off my back,' she added.

Aniston said she could relate to aspects of the character because she, too, is a public figure.

'I understand the isolation - not wanting to be seen, not wanting to be public, not wanting to have to go on a red carpet,' Aniston said. 'It’s not always easy to go out there and have to be the person that you have to be.'

New project: Aniston plays a veteran morning show anchor named Alex Levy on her new Apple TV+ series The Morning Show

Aniston, who appeared alongside Adam Sandler, 53, in the Netflix movie Murder Mystery earlier this summer, recently spoke about the ups and downs of being famous in a May Harper's Bazaar piece.

The Just Go With It star said that most the time she really enjoys interacting with fans because '90 percent of the people are happy and excited.'

But after decades of fame, Aniston said she has had to set some boundaries with fans.

'If I’m in the middle of dinner, no, I don’t want you to take my picture,' she said. 'I try to have a rule: I only take photos with kids. It was a hard boundary for me to create because people get really pi**ed off at you. But you have to have limits. Otherwise you’ll just be standing there doing selfies on a corner for decades'
